member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.CommandState
member.summary: Represents the various states that a command might have.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.CommandState.IsAvailable
member.summary: If true, the command should be visible and enabled in the UI.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.CommandState.IsChecked
member.summary: If true, the command should appear as checked (i.e. toggled) in the UI.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.CommandState.DisplayText
member.summary: If specified, returns the custom text that should be displayed in the UI.

members.member: Error tolerance case for "foo[]" which is parsed as an ArrayTypeSyntax variable declaration instead of an ElementAccessExpression

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.IDeferredQuickInfoContent
member.summary: Interface to allow providers to return some sort of quick info content whose creation can be deferred to a later point (and on the UI thread)

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.ISignatureHelpProvider.IsTriggerCharacter(System.Char)
member.summary: Returns true if the character might trigger completion, e.g. '(' and ',' for method invocations

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.ISignatureHelpProvider.IsRetriggerCharacter(System.Char)
member.summary: Returns true if the character might end a Signature Help session, e.g. ')' for method invocations.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.ISignatureHelpProvider.GetItemsAsync(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Document,System.Int32,Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.SignatureHelpTriggerInfo,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Returns valid signature help items at the specified position in the document.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.SignatureHelpItems.Items
member.summary: The list of items to present to the user.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.SignatureHelpItems.ApplicableSpan
member.summary:
The span this session applies to.
Navigation outside this span will cause signature help to be dismissed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.SignatureHelpItems.ArgumentIndex
member.summary: Returns the specified argument index that the provided position is at in the current document. This index may be greater than the number of arguments in the selected .

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.SignatureHelpItems.ArgumentCount
member.summary: Returns the total number of arguments that have been typed in the current document. This may be greater than the ArgumentIndex if there are additional arguments after the provided position.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.SignatureHelpItems.ArgumentName
member.summary:
Returns the name of specified argument at the current position in the document. This only applies to languages that allow the user to provide named arguments. If no named argument exists at the current position, then null should be returned.
This value is used to determine which documentation comment should be provided for the current parameter. Normally this is determined simply by determining the parameter by index.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.SignatureHelpItems.SelectedItemIndex
member.summary: The item to select by default. If this is null then the controller will pick the first item that has enough arguments to be viable based on what argument position the user is currently inside of.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.SignatureHelpItem.IsVariadic
member.summary: True if this signature help item can have an unbounded number of arguments passed to it. If it is variadic then the last parameter will be considered selected, even if the selected parameter index strictly goes past the number of defined parameters for this item.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.SignatureHelpParameter.Name
member.summary: The name of this parameter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.SignatureHelpParameter.DocumentationFactory
member.summary: Documentation for this parameter. This should normally be presented to the user when this parameter is selected.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.SignatureHelpParameter.PrefixDisplayParts
member.summary: Display parts to show before the normal display parts for the parameter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.SignatureHelpParameter.SuffixDisplayParts
member.summary: Display parts to show after the normal display parts for the parameter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.SignatureHelpParameter.DisplayParts
member.summary: Display parts for this parameter. This should normally be presented to the user as part of the entire signature display.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.SignatureHelpParameter.IsOptional
member.summary: True if this parameter is optional or not. Optional parameters may be presented in a different manner to users.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.SignatureHelpParameter.SelectedDisplayParts
member.summary: Display parts for this parameter that should be presented to the user when this parameter is selected.

member.summary: Signature Help was triggered through the 'Invoke Signature Help' command

member.summary: Signature Help was triggered through the 'Type Char' command.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.SignatureHelpTriggerReason.RetriggerCommand
member.summary: Signature Help was triggered through typing a closing brace.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.ITaskItem.MappedFilePath
member.summary: Null if path is not mapped and contains the actual path. Note that the value might be a relative path. In that case should be used as a base path for path resolution.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.ITodoListProvider
member.summary: Returns Roslyn todo list from the workspace.

member.name: E:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.ITodoListProvider.TodoListUpdated
member.summary:
An event that is raised when the todo list has changed.
When an event handler is newly added, this event will fire for the currently available todo items and then afterward for any changes since.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.Host.IPreviewDialogService
member.summary: Displays the Preview Changes Dialog comparing two solutions.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.Host.IPreviewDialogService.PreviewChanges(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Glyph,Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Solution,Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Solution,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Presents the user a preview of the changes, based on a textual diff between and .
member.param: The title of the preview changes dialog.
The keyword used by F1 help in the dialog.
Text to display above the treeview in the dialog.
The name of the root item in the treeview in the dialog.
The of the root item in the treeview.
Whether or not preview dialog should display item checkboxes.
member.returns: Returns with the changes selected in the dialog applied. Returns null if cancelled.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.IInlineRenameService
member.summary: Provides services for starting an interactive rename session.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.IInlineRenameService.StartInlineSession(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Document,Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Text.TextSpan,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Starts an interactive rename session. If an existing inline session was active, it will commit the previous session, possibly causing changes to the text buffer.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.IInlineRenameService.ActiveSession
member.summary: Returns the currently active inline session, or null if none is active.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.InlineRenameSessionInfo.CanRename
member.summary: Whether or not the entity at the selected location can be renamed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.InlineRenameSessionInfo.LocalizedErrorMessage
member.summary: Provides the reason that can be displayed to the user if the entity at the selected location cannot be renamed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.InlineRenameSessionInfo.Session
member.summary: The session created if it was possible to rename the entity.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.IInlineRenameSession.Cancel
member.summary: Cancels the rename session, and undoes any edits that had been performed by the session.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.IInlineRenameSession.Commit(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Dismisses the rename session, completing the rename operation across all files.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.IRefactorNotifyService
member.summary: Allows editors to listen to refactoring events and take appropriate action. For example, when VS knows about a symbol rename, it asks the Xaml language service to update xaml files

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.IRefactorNotifyService.TryOnBeforeGlobalSymbolRenamed(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Workspace,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.DocumentId},Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ISymbol,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Notifies any interested parties that a rename action is about to happen. Implementers can request the rename action be cancelled, in which case they should return false or throw an exception, depending on the throwOnFailure argument. Callers should honor cancellation requests by not applying the rename and not calling .
member.returns: True if the rename should proceed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.IRefactorNotifyService.TryOnAfterGlobalSymbolRenamed(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Workspace,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.DocumentId},Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ISymbol,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Notifies any interested parties that a symbol rename has been applied to the workspace. This should only be called if was called and returned true before the symbol rename was applied to the workspace. In the event of a failure to rename, implementers should return false or throw an exception, depending on the throwOnFailure argument.
member.returns: True if the rename was successful.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.Shared.Extensions.IWorkspaceExtensions.ApplyDocumentChanges(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Workspace,Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Document,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Update the workspace so that the document with the Id of has the text of newDocument. If the document is open, then this method will determine a minimal set of changes to apply to the document.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.Shared.Extensions.IWorkspaceExtensions.ApplyTextChanges(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Workspace,Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.DocumentId,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Text.TextChange},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Update the solution so that the document with the Id has the text changes

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.Shared.Extensions.IWorkspaceExtensions.ApplyTextChanges(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Workspace,Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.DocumentId,Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Text.TextChange,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Update the solution so that the document with the Id has the text changes

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.Shared.Options.EditorComponentOnOffOptions
member.summary: options to indicate whether a certain component in Roslyn is enabled or not

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.Shared.Options.FeatureOnOffOptions.RenameTracking
member.summary: This option is currently usued by Roslyn, but we might want to implement it in the future. Keeping the option while it's unimplemented allows all upgrade paths to maintain any customized value for this setting, even through versions that have not implemented this feature yet.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.Shared.Options.FeatureOnOffOptions.RefactoringVerification
member.summary: This option is currently usued by Roslyn, but we might want to implement it in the future. Keeping the option while it's unimplemented allows all upgrade paths to maintain any customized value for this setting, even through versions that have not implemented this feature yet.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.Shared.Utilities.ResettableDelay.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Threading.Tasks.TaskScheduler)
member.summary: Create a ResettableDelay that will complete a task after a certain duration. The delay can be reset at any point before it elapses in which case completion is postponed. The delay can be reset multiple times.
member.param: The time to delay before completing the task
Optional. If used, the delay won't start until the supplied TaskScheduler schedules the delay to begin.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.SymbolMapping.ISymbolMappingService.MapSymbolAsync(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Document,Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.SymbolKey,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Given a and the document whence the corresponding came, locate an identical symbol in the correct solution for performing common symbol operations (e.g. find references) as defined by this service.
member.param: The document whence the symbol came
The id of the symbol to map
member.returns: The matching symbol from the correct solution or null

member.summary: Given an and the document whence the corresponding came, locate an identical symbol in the correct solution for performing common symbol operations (e.g. find references) as defined by this service.
member.param: The document whence the symbol came
member.returns: The matching symbol from the correct solution or null
